terms.modal_intro: By checking this box, you accept that:
terms.modal_items:
You are responsible for what you publish and having the rights to publish it.
You retain ownership of your content but grant us a license to host and display it.
You understand public content can be viewed by others.
You agree to our community rules, reporting policy, and moderation system.
Administrators may take appropriate actions, including banning, against users who violate our rules or engage in misconduct.
Content involving sexual content, harm, drugs, illegal activities, or other prohibited material is strictly forbidden and will be monitored.
terms.accept_checkbox: I have read and accept the Terms and Conditions
terms.must_accept: You must accept the Terms and Conditions to continue

general_provisions.title: General Provisions
general_provisions.user_responsibility: You are responsible for what you publish and for having the rights to publish it.
general_provisions.platform_license: We don't claim ownership of your property, but you grant us a license to host, display, and distribute within the service.
general_provisions.no_originality_guarantee: We do not guarantee originality (we are not judges of external authorship).
general_provisions.publishing_responsibility: You are responsible for what you publish (and for having the rights to do so).

definitions.title: 1. Definitions
definitions.content_def: "Content": Ideas, texts, images, audio, comments, files, and any material that a user publishes or shares on the platform.
definitions.publish_def: "Publish": Making Content visible to other users (public, followers, invitees, or private spaces).
definitions.attribution_def: "Attribution": Visible mention of the original author and link to the original publication within the platform.

ownership.title: 2. Ownership and License
ownership.ownership_content: You retain ownership of your Content. The platform does not claim ownership over the ideas or content you publish.
ownership.license_title: 2.2 Limited License to Operate the Service
ownership.license_content: By publishing or sharing Content, you grant us a non-exclusive license to host, process, reproduce, display, and distribute it within the platform in order to operate and improve the service (e.g., showing it in feeds, allowing sharing according to your permissions, and maintaining backups).
ownership.deletion_content: If you delete your Content, we will stop displaying it publicly; however, it may remain for a limited time in backups, technical logs, or where necessary for security, fraud prevention, or compliance.

public_content.title: 3. Public Publishing and Risks
public_content.exposure_content: If you publish Content with public visibility, you understand that other users can view it, comment on it, and that outside the platform, they could copy or share it. We cannot prevent or control uses outside the platform.
public_content.sensitive_content: If an idea is sensitive, we recommend using private drafts or sharing only with invitees/private spaces before publishing publicly.

user_responsibility.title: 4. User Responsibility
user_responsibility.content: You are responsible for the Content you publish and for ensuring that you have the necessary rights, permissions, or authorizations.

appropriation.title: 5. Appropriation Within the Platform
appropriation.prohibition_content: It is not allowed to republish within the platform another user's content by passing it off as your own, without clear attribution, or using methods to hide the origin.
appropriation.similar_content: If we detect that a publication is very similar to a previous one, we may request attribution, limit its reach, or send it for review, especially if there is a report.

disputes.title: 6. Disputes and Internal Decisions
disputes.external_content: We do not resolve disputes about authorship or intellectual property that occur outside the platform, nor do we investigate external facts that we cannot reasonably verify.
disputes.internal_content: The actions we take (reduce visibility, remove, sanction) are based on compliance with our internal rules and information available within the platform; they do not constitute a legal determination of rights.

reports.title: 7. Reports and Notice & Action
reports.how_content: Any user can report content for: appropriation/plagiarism within the platform, identity impersonation, rights infringement (copyright/trademark) when applicable, harassment, spam, or other rule violations.
reports.include_content: For appropriation reports within the platform, required: link to the allegedly original publication (within the platform), link to the reported publication, brief explanation (why you believe it's a copy), optional: additional evidence.
reports.temporary_content: We may apply temporary measures such as: limiting reach ("deboost"), preventing edits, temporarily hiding, while we evaluate the case.
reports.outcomes_content: After review, we may: take no action, request or impose attribution, limit distribution, remove content, or sanction the account.
reports.appeal_content: The affected user may request review/appeal by providing context or evidence.

sanctions.title: 8. Sanctions for Repeat Offenses
sanctions.strikes_content: If a user repeatedly engages in appropriation within the platform or ignores attribution requests, we may apply progressive sanctions: 1. warning, 2. limitations (publishing/reach), 3. temporary suspension, 4. permanent suspension.
sanctions.abuse_content: Accounts created to copy, impersonate, or spam may be restricted or suspended immediately.

admin_actions.title: 9. Administrator Actions
admin_actions.discretion_content: Administrators have the right to take appropriate actions, at their discretion, against users who violate our terms of service, engage in misconduct, or pose a threat to the platform or community. This includes but is not limited to issuing warnings, limiting account functionality, suspending accounts, or permanently banning users.
admin_actions.enforcement_content: Administrative actions are taken to maintain a safe, respectful, and compliant environment for all users. The platform reserves the right to act swiftly in cases of severe violations without prior warning.

prohibited_content.title: 10. Prohibited Content
prohibited_content.forbidden_content: Content involving sexual content, explicit material, harm, violence, drugs, illegal activities, hate speech, or other prohibited material is strictly forbidden on the platform.
prohibited_content.monitoring_content: All content published on the platform is subject to monitoring to ensure compliance with these terms. Prohibited content may be removed without notice, and users responsible for publishing such content may face account suspension or banning.

transparency.title: 11. Transparency and Traceability
transparency.logs_content: We maintain technical logs (e.g., timestamps, versions, action logs) for security, abuse prevention, and resolving reports within the platform.
transparency.limitation_content: These logs do not by themselves guarantee legal authorship, but they help manage compliance with internal rules and prevent abuse.

liability.title: 12. Limitation of Liability
liability.third_party_content: The platform hosts third-party content. We are not responsible for content published by users nor for uses that third parties make of content outside the platform.
liability.commitment_content: We are committed to offering privacy, reporting, and moderation tools, and to:
liability.timestamps: Immutable Timestamps: Each published idea generates a date and time record that serves as proof of prior existence against any copy.
liability.version_history: Version History: Allows the ideator to demonstrate the evolution of their thinking, from initial concept to refined or pivoted, maintaining a record of their authorship at each stage.
liability.revision_history: Visible Revision History: If an ideator pivots or refines their idea, the system must save and show (if the user desires) the evolution of the concept. This demonstrates that the user is the "parent" of the idea from conception.

ideas.discover_ideas: Discover and vote on validated business ideas

slide0.headline: You don‚Äôt have to decide
slide0.subheadline: Waiting for external signal is rational. We help you reduce uncertainty before committing.

slide1.headline: Identify the
slide1.subheadline: Surface liability, trust, and clarity risks to understand what makes this decision costly to reverse.

slide2.headline: Challenge your
slide2.subheadline: Independent perspectives and evidence question assumptions and expose tradeoffs before you move forward.

slide3.headline: Turn signal into a
slide3.subheadline: See what‚Äôs solid, what‚Äôs still uncertain, and what needs more evidence before you commit.

slide4.headline: Track decision
slide4.subheadline: Follow signal and evidence patterns to understand whether confidence is increasing or still insufficient.

dashboard.title: Browse Ideas
dashboard.subtitle: Discover and vote on validated business ideas
dashboard.search_placeholder: Search ideas by title, description, or tags...
dashboard.no_filters_applied: No filters applied. Click "Add Filter" to create filtering conditions.

activity.title: Activity
activity.no_ideas: You haven't created any ideas yet
activity.no_ideas_description: Start by sharing your first idea to see your activity here

validation.title: Validation Signals
validation.description: Key metrics that indicate how well your ideas are being validated by the community.
validation.pay_conversion_tooltip: The percentage of voters who selected 'I'd pay for it' for your ideas. Higher rates indicate strong market validation and willingness to pay for your solution.
validation.pay_conversion_desc: % of voters who would pay for your ideas
validation.time_to_vote_tooltip: Average time it takes for your ideas to receive their first vote after publishing. Faster times indicate better initial visibility and appeal.
validation.time_to_vote_desc: How quickly your ideas get noticed
validation.time_to_comment_tooltip: How quickly discussions begin on your ideas. Faster engagement typically correlates with clearer value propositions and compelling content.
validation.time_to_comment_desc: When discussions start around your ideas
validation.community_sentiment_tooltip: Ratio of positive feedback ('use' + 'pay' votes) to negative feedback ('dislike' votes). Higher ratios indicate stronger market validation.

trends.title: Engagement Trends
trends.description: Track how engagement with your ideas changes over time.
trends.vote_velocity_tooltip: Average number of votes your ideas receive per day in the last 30 days. Higher velocity indicates growing momentum.
trends.total_views_tooltip: Total number of times your ideas have been viewed. Each page load counts as a view.
trends.unique_viewers_tooltip: Number of distinct users who have viewed your ideas. This metric helps measure your reach.
trends.votes_14_days_tooltip: Total votes received in the last 14 days. Use this to track recent engagement trends.
trends.no_data_desc: Data will appear as your ideas receive engagement

ai.title: AI Value Insights
ai.description: Compare performance of ideas with and without AI features.
ai.ideas_with_ai_tooltip: Performance metrics for ideas where you used at least one AI feature (AI comments, Deep Research, or Personas Evaluation)
ai.ideas_without_ai_tooltip: Performance metrics for ideas where you didn't use any AI features. Compare with AI-enhanced ideas to measure impact.
ai.ai_impact_tooltip: Shows the percentage improvement in key metrics when using AI features vs. not using them. Positive numbers indicate AI is helping your ideas perform better.
ai.vote_lift_tooltip: Percentage increase in average votes for AI-enhanced ideas compared to non-AI ideas
ai.pay_rate_lift_tooltip: Percentage increase in 'I'd pay for it' conversion rate for AI-enhanced ideas vs. non-AI ideas
ai.feature_usage_tooltip: Track how many times you've used each AI feature across all your ideas
ai.ai_comments_tooltip: Number of ideas with AI-generated initial comments from our personas
ai.personas_eval_tooltip: Number of times you ran Personas Evaluation to get expert feedback from 5 AI personas
ai.deep_research_tooltip: Number of times you ran AI Deep Research to get comprehensive market validation and competitor analysis

idea_analytics.title: Idea Analytics
idea_analytics.subtitle: Detailed insights about this idea
idea_analytics.score_description: This score reflects the overall market validation of your idea. Higher scores indicate stronger market potential.
idea_analytics.vote_meaning_description: Votes help determine the feasibility and impact of your idea:
idea_analytics.up_vote: I would use this - Indicates market demand
idea_analytics.down_vote: I wouldn't use this - Indicates potential issues
idea_analytics.pay_vote: I would pay for this - Strongest validation signal
idea_analytics.no_comments: No comments yet for this idea
idea_analytics.sentiment_description: This chart shows the overall sentiment of your idea based on user votes. "Use" votes indicate positive interest, "Pay" votes show strong validation, and "Dislike" votes suggest concerns.
idea_analytics.suggestion_1: Consider addressing concerns from users who wouldn't use this product
idea_analytics.suggestion_2: Explore ways to increase perceived value to encourage more "I would pay" votes
idea_analytics.suggestion_3: Encourage more user feedback and discussion to validate your idea further
idea_analytics.suggestion_4: Add relevant tags to help users discover your idea
idea_analytics.all_good: Your idea is performing well! Keep up the great work and continue engaging with your audience.

signal_overview.title: Signal Overview
signal_overview.subtitle: Cross-idea signal and behavioral evidence. This does not evaluate ideas. It shows external response patterns.
signal_overview.preview_login_message: This is a preview with sample data. Sign in to see your real analytics.
signal_overview.signal_mix_desc: What is the external signal composition across all decisions?
signal_overview.signal_mix_explain: The stacked bar shows how all votes across your ideas are split: Dislike, Like, and I'd pay for it. Total Signals is the sum of all votes; Pay Intention Ratio is the share of votes that are I'd pay for it. This gives you the overall response mix without judging any single idea.
signal_overview.signal_drift_desc: Vote change over time (last 30 days). % signal volatility, % signal reversal events.
signal_overview.signal_drift_explain: The line chart shows how vote volume changes day by day over the last 30 days. It reflects signal volatility and reversal patterns‚Äîuseful to see whether response is steady or shifting over time.

attention.exposure_desc: Does content earn serious attention or passive exposure?
attention.exposure_explain: System-level metrics for how often your ideas appear in feeds, how many unique people see them, and how long they are viewed or hovered before any click.
attention.detail_behavior_explain: When someone opens an idea (detail view), these metrics show how long they stay, how far they scroll, and how often they come back. The histograms show the distribution of dwell times and scroll depth so you can see whether attention is shallow or deep.

behavioral.decision_latency_desc: What do people do before deciding? Impulsive vs reasoned signal.
behavioral.decision_latency_explain: Time from opening the idea (detail view) to casting a vote. Lower times can mean quick decisions; the share of votes after comment or after AI comment shows how many people reacted after reading discussion.
behavioral.avg_detail_to_signal: Avg time from detail view ‚Üí signal
behavioral.comment_depth_explain: How much people discuss: comments per idea, average length, reply depth, thread participation, and edit/upvote-downvote ratio. The reply depth distribution chart shows how conversation threads branch.
behavioral.return_behavior_explain: Whether people come back: average return sessions per user, how engagement decays over time, and the share of users who return within 7 days.
behavioral.risk_signals_desc: Silent risk indicators. No red screaming alerts ‚Äî just numbers.
behavioral.risk_signals_explain: Early exit rate (leaving very quickly), high views with few signals, comments without votes, votes without comments, and high dwell with no vote.

decision_evidence.title: Decision Evidence
decision_evidence.subtitle: External signal and behavioral data for this decision.
decision_evidence.signal_composition_explain: Vote breakdown for this idea only: share of Dislike, Like, and I'd pay for it, total signals, and how the mix changed over time (volatility and time-series). No recommendation‚Äîjust the composition and trend.
decision_evidence.attention_depth_explain: How this idea is consumed: detail views, average and median dwell time, scroll depth, return rate, and time to first signal or comment. The dwell distribution chart shows how long people stay before leaving or acting.
decision_evidence.behavioral_context_explain: Vote latency, the share of votes that happen after a comment or after an AI comment, comment depth and length, early exit rate, and high-dwell-no-vote share.
decision_evidence.segment_table_explain: Breakdown by audience type: First-time viewers, Returning viewers, Space members, and External testers. Each row shows how many signals that segment gave, their average dwell time on the idea, and the vote mix (Like, Dislike, I'd pay for it) for that segment. Use this to see whether different audiences respond differently.

example.message: Sign in to unlock your personal activity dashboard and analytics. Here's a preview of what you can access:
example.feature_1: Track all your submitted ideas in one place
example.feature_2: View detailed analytics and performance metrics
example.feature_3: Get insights on market validation and user feedback

example.idea_description_2: Sustainable and biodegradable packaging solution for the food industry.
example.idea_description_3: A social networking app focused on professional development and mentorship.

market_validation.title: AI Market Validation & Analysis
market_validation.disclaimer: These signals reduce uncertainty but do not predict success. Market outcomes depend on execution, timing, and external factors.

snapshot.intro: This snapshot frames the customer segment and market context for this idea, anchoring all subsequent validation signals.

hypotheses.intro: These hypotheses validate your idea across 5 behavioral layers, from problem existence to willingness to pay. Each is backed by evidence from web research.

existence.title: Problem Existence
existence.description: The problem actually occurs for the identified segment

awareness.title: Problem Awareness
awareness.description: Users recognize and articulate the problem

consideration.title: Solution Consideration
consideration.description: Users actively seek solutions or workarounds

intent.title: Adoption Intent
intent.description: Users show intent to adopt a solution

pay_intention.title: Willingness to Pay
pay_intention.description: Users demonstrate willingness to pay for a solution

signals.intro: These market-level signals validate demand strength, timing, and competitive fit beyond individual hypotheses.

demand_intensity.title: Demand Intensity & Momentum
demand_intensity.description: Whether demand is emerging, growing, stable, or declining

problem_salience.title: Problem Salience & Urgency
problem_salience.description: How painful and time-sensitive the problem is

existing_spend.title: Existing Spend & Budget Signals
existing_spend.description: Whether money is already flowing in this space

switching_friction.title: Switching & Adoption Friction
switching_friction.description: Ease of adoption and switching costs

existing_workarounds.title: Existing Workarounds
existing_workarounds.description: How people solve the problem today without your solution

competitors.title: Direct and Possible Competitors
competitors.description: Who else serves this need and how

social_trend.title: Social Media Trending
social_trend.description: Buzz and behavior on TikTok, Instagram, and similar

cost_per_attention.title: Cost-Per-Attention Signals
cost_per_attention.description: What it costs to reach and engage this audience

channel_fit.title: Channel‚ÄìIdea Fit
channel_fit.description: Whether your channels can reach and convert this market

share_triggers.title: Share Triggers
share_triggers.description: What makes people share or recommend in this space

market_sophistication.title: Market Sophistication Level
market_sophistication.description: How mature and informed the market is

objection_density.title: Objection Density
objection_density.description: Common objections and friction in this space

conflicts_gaps.intro: This section highlights contradictions, missing data, and risk flags that require attention.
conflicts_gaps.no_major_issues_description: The analysis didn't identify major contradictions or critical missing signals. This doesn't guarantee success, but suggests consistency in available data.

synthesis.intro: This synthesis combines all signals to highlight what looks strong, what's concerning, and what to test next.
synthesis.disclaimer: This is advisory guidance. Success depends on execution, timing, and factors beyond this analysis.
